wikipedia_page.main: Frederick George Lee (6 January 1832 in Thame, Oxfordshire – 22 January 1902 at Lambeth, London) was a priest of the Church of England and a religious author. He co-founded the Order of Corporate Reunion.

response: Lee was born in Aberdeen, the second son of Reverend Frederick George Lee, vicar of All Saints', Lambeth. He was educated at St Mary's College, Harlow and Westminster School and became an artist and designer.

The Order of Corporate Reunion (OCR), officially the Christian, Ecumenical, and Fraternal Order of Corporate Reunion, is an ecumenical association of clergy and laity of Anglican origin. The OCR was founded by Frederick George Lee, Thomas Wimberley Mossman, and John Thomas Seccombe in 1874 in London. Established as an Anglo-Papalist society to continue the work of the Association for the Promotion of the Unity of Christendom, its founders labored to restore an apostolic succession recognised by the Catholic Church through reordinations as a means for reunion.Henry R. T. Brandreth, Dr Lee of Lambeth: A Chapter in Parenthesis in the History of the Oxford Movement, London, 1951.

At the First Vatican Council he was the leader of the minority of Italian bishops who opposed the introduction of the doctrine of papal infallibility, but after the proclamation of the dogma he promptly undersigned it. He also became known, centuries after his death, as one of the principal consecrators of Frederick George Lee in the Order of Corporate Reunion.
